reporting-org.narrative: UK - Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

title.narrative: British Council - Malaysia - Newton Fund

description.narrative: The Newton Fund uses science and innovation partnerships to promote economic development and social welfare of partner countries.

The Newton Fund's primary objective is to reduce poverty by generating and putting into use knowledge and technology to address development challenges and advance development for the poorest people and countries. We will seek to maximise the practical impact of research and innovation to improve the lives and opportunities of the global poor. In achieving this we will grow the research and innovation capacity of developing countries, as well as contributing to the continued strength of the UK’s research and innovation system, and support our wider prosperity and global influence.

title.narrative: Institutional Links Call October (2014)

description.narrative: Grants for research and innovation collaborations between the UK and partner countries to support the translation of research into benefit

To initiate new research and innovation collaborations between academic groups, departments and institutions in partner countries and the UK and support the exchange of research and innovation expertise and the translation of research knowledge into tangible benefits. Target: 4 Institutional Links grants awarded in 2015

title.narrative: Researcher Links Workshop Grant Call April and July (2015)

description.narrative: Grants for workshops in priority research areas defined in Malaysia, which allow UK and Malaysia researchers to share their research with early career researchers and promote relationships among early career researchers for longer term collaboration.

To build sustainable research links between the UK and partner countries and build capacity for engagement in international research collaboration in areas that are relevant to economic development and social welfare. 6 workshops per year each with 20 researchers from the UK and 20 from Malaysia

title.narrative: Professional development - Research Management and Governance (Phase 1)

description.narrative: Suporting policy makers in research management and governance improvement, numerous strands of engagement with a view to supporting best practice

The programme aims to review current research management and governance framework and identify needs for improvement, to evaluate and adapt some of the UK best practices in research management and governance and to make recommendations for improvement of research management and governance in Malaysia

title.narrative: Famelab 2015

description.narrative: Communication and media training for young scientists . With a view to wider youth science engagement across the landscape and developing communication skills

Science communication training and competition (FameLab) to promote science communication amongst researchers. Researchers will be trained on public engagement, developing media and presentation skills through Communication Masterclass and Researcher Connect training.

title.narrative: Researcher Links Workshop Grant Regional April Call (2017)

description.narrative: Grants for workshops in priority research areas defined in Malaysia, which allow UK and Malaysia researchers to share their research with early career researchers with Newton countries in the region and promote relationships among early career researchers for longer term collaboration.

To build sustainable research links between the UK and partner countries and build capacity for engagement in international research collaboration in areas that are relevant to economic development and social welfare. 2 workshops per year each with 10 researchers from the UK, 10 from Malaysia, 20 from other Newton Countries in the region

reporting-org.narrative: UK - Department for Business, Energy and Industrial Strategy

title.narrative: Professional Development Education (PDE) – 2019 - Research translation – Workshops for key players responsible for governance and management of technology transfer in Malaysia

description.narrative: Workshops to build capacity of players in Malaysia Tech Transfer field and establish best practices and model for good governance and management of technology transfer in Malaysia including policy and regulation to support it. Provide a platform that encourages the multiplayers in the field to work together.

To build Malaysia key player’s understanding on the two key challenges (governance and regulatory) and building build their capacity to address the two key challenges; to create a conducive and supportive knowledge exchange and technology transfer governance, legal and regulatory framework in Malaysia; to bring together all key technology transfer stakeholders and create a cohesive knowledge exchange and technology transfer landscape in Malaysia
